comments: Everything is read off powerpoints and he has speakers come in. Four exams, lowest gets dropped, the grade is average of the three. His teaching style in 300 classes will not prepare you for the difficult 400 finance classes, but as an elective it was easy. You are never there the whole class period (night class).

tag_professor: Caring (9)  Respected (8)  Clear grading criteria (5)  Hilarious (3)  Gives good feedback (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: Professor Sadusky directs his lectures more towards what you\'ll actually experience while working in Finance. He ties current events into his lectures daily, and you often get out early. He teaches the curriculum well, easy tests to make sure you retained everything. very clear study guides that tell you exactly what to know for the tests.

comments: The lectures are boring and pointless. Nothing from the lectures comes on the test. Also, the study guides were not that helpful. Even though the attendance is not mandatory, he takes random attendance at class and counts it as the part of the grade though it is not written in the syllabus. The test are horrible. Take someone else.

comments: Lectures were pointless. But, he knew the material. He drops one of the 3 exams, but the final is MANDATORY! Homework was easy, and the tests were doable if you studied.

tag_professor: Caring (9)  Respected (8)  Clear grading criteria (5)  Hilarious (3)  Gives good feedback (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: The lectures are pointless. He doesn\'t go over anything useful or any math problems that are on the tests. His class is mostly tests. He reads a lot of irrelevant newspaper articles during lecture. He seems like a nice guy, nothing against him but he does not know how to be a finance professor. Choose another one unless you don\'t want to pass FIN.

comments: Sadusky is the BEST choice for finance at ASU. 90 percent of your grade is based off of exams, but they\'re very fair and he drops one. Although attendance isn\'t mandatory, he always shares interesting stories relating to the material. He\'s so kind and genuinely cares about the success of his students.

comments: Great professor. Worked in the industry and knows what he is talking about. Genuine guy. Exams are fairly easy. On top of 4 exams, only 3 homework assignments for the entire semester.

stu_tags: CARING  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
comments: Great professor everything is very clear and he\'s willing to help anyone who asks. Tests are worth 90% of your grade but as long as you look at his study guide you\'ll get at least a B. I took it as an accelerated summer course and worked 60 hours a week putting in 30 mins max of studying per test and got an A-.

tag_professor: Caring (9)  Respected (8)  Clear grading criteria (5)  Hilarious (3)  Gives good feedback (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: Brian Sadusky was an amazing Professor. I took this class twice. First with Garret and hated it. The second time with Sadusky and he made Finance so darn interesting. He real life stories that apply to the concepts. The exams are fair and straight forwards. No trick questions. This class was not too hard or too easy. It was just right.

tag_professor: Caring (9)  Respected (8)  Clear grading criteria (5)  Hilarious (3)  Gives good feedback (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Get ready to read (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: I would recommend this class to anybody. Sadusky is really great and caring if you dont have a book hell let you borrow one hes really great at helping you understand concepts. usually lets us out early. hw every week pretty easy. Gives a study guide that contains 95-100% of whats on the exams. Excel modules suck but theres only 3. Easy A.

comments: It\'s been 3 months and we really haven\'t done anything in this class. But if you do have an exam, he\'ll send out a study guide a few days before the exam, and it\'ll tell you about 95% that\'ll be on the test (probably about assigned articles). Great and funny guy, should be an easy A, and is a relaxing elective for the major.

He really cares and gives you all of the resources to succeed. He drops a test and puts out study guides for all of them.

comments: I absolutely loved Sadusky. I would take more classes with him if I could. Put in a little effort and you\'ll get a good grade. He makes jokes, relates the material to current issues and he\'s just adorable.

comments: Professor Sadusky was such a great professor who cares about his students. You can email him personally and he will get back to you in a timely fashion. Homeworks get full credit if you turn them in and show you tried. Really funny and makes finance tolerable. Would take him again if I had other finance classes.

comments: He was the best professor I have ever had at ASU. Professor Sandusky cares greatly about each and and every one of his students, and is willing to help. I never thought I would say this, but he makes Finance interesting and enjoyable! Homework is not too difficult, and it prepares you for the upcoming tests. If you can, TAKE HIM. He is amazing.

comments: Took night fin 431. EASIEST CLASS EVER. He let us out halfway though or earlier every night. Plus a speaker, 2 canceled classes... We had like 12 hours of actual class. 4 tests, mostly mc & very easy. Some pbs videos are assigned but almost no hw. Insight in banking but did learn much about anything else. Very funny guy. Cares. Take for an easy A.
